  • Method Details

    • infoBox

      public static void infoBox(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType type, String infoMessage, String headerText, String title)
      Message Boxes
      Parameters:
      type - allows you to choose what type of Alert you want it to be, e.g. warning, informational,error, etc.
      infoMessage - is where I place the message for the alert.
      headerText - is the header text
      title - is the title in the border of the alert.

    • apptAlerts

      public static void apptAlerts(int code)
      This method applies the switch block which allows me to choose which case I want to be shown in the alert used for ApptAMController.
      Parameters:
      code - associated the integer and the message I want to use throughout my code.

    • customerAlerts

      public static void customerAlerts(int code)
      This method applies the switch block which allows me to choose which case I want to be shown in the alert used for CustAMController.
      Parameters:
      code - associated the integer and the message I want to use throughout my code.

    • closeRequest

      public static void closeRequest(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      This message prompts a message when clicking the X on the Title bar in the ApptAMContoller and CustAMController. In the lambda expression passed to the setOnCloseRequest method the CloseRequest event is represented by the argument evt.
      Parameters:
      stage - allows me to use the name of the stage I chose, so that when I click the X on that stage the message will appear.

    • cancelButtons

      public static void cancelButtons(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Alert appears when the cancel buttons are clicked on the ApptAMController or CustAMController.
